docs.snippet: Oscar De La Hoya's face stands 50 feet high on an HBO billboard in Times Square. ''DE LA HOYA,'' it says. ''LIVE FROM MADISON SQUARE GARDEN.''    But who is he fighting? Livia Soprano? For all the sign says, he could be choosing from ringside....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oscar De La Hoya's face stands 50 feet high on an HBO billboard in Times Square. ''DE LA HOYA,'' it says. ''LIVE FROM MADISON SQUARE GARDEN.'' But who is he fighting? Livia Soprano? For all the sign says, he could be choosing from ringside.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir, in TV Sports column, criticizes HBO for promoting Oscar De La Hoya-Derrell Coley welterweight bout at Madison Square Garden with billboards and posters that exclude Coley (M)

headline.main: Coley Is Nowhere In Ads for His Fight

docs.snippet: A PLEA to compassionate New Yorkers: the time has come to open your wallets and help send a chorus boy or girl away from Manhattan for a week of clean country air and sunshine.    You've no doubt noticed how consumptive many of them have been look...
docs.lead_paragraph: A PLEA to compassionate New Yorkers: the time has come to open your wallets and help send a chorus boy or girl away from Manhattan for a week of clean country air and sunshine. You've no doubt noticed how consumptive many of them have been looking lately, with that graveyard pallor and those black-rimmed eyes. And it can't help that they are often walking around wearing next to nothing in what hardly look like sanitary environments. Oh, you know who I'm talking about: the cellblock hussies from ''Chicago,'' the Weimar club kids from ''Cabaret,'' the erotic robots from ''Fosse.''
docs.abstract: Ben Brantley reviews Andrew Lippa's The Wild Party, Jazz Age musical inspired by Joseph Moncure March's 1928 cult poem; Gabriel Barre directs production for Manhattan Theater Club; photos (M)

headline.main: A Jazz Age Tale Of Lust and Death

docs.snippet: A disc jockey was spinning high-decibel rap, R&B and hip-hop records in between large men hitting each other about the head last night at the Hammerstein Ballroom.    The V.I.P. room on the lower level had free cigars and massages before the bouts...
docs.lead_paragraph: A disc jockey was spinning high-decibel rap, R&B and hip-hop records in between large men hitting each other about the head last night at the Hammerstein Ballroom. The V.I.P. room on the lower level had free cigars and massages before the bouts started. Go-go dancers performed on platforms outside the ring. Beer flowed freely. The place reeked of machismo.
docs.abstract: Shannon Briggs stops Warren Williams in third round of heavyweight bout at Hammerstein Ballroom in midtown Manhattan; about 1,500 people attend promoter Cedric Kushner's monthly Heavyweight Explosion show at ballroom; photos (M)

headline.main: In and Out of the Ring, Dancing at Hammerstein

docs.snippet: Colombia took advantage of two major defensive lapses, including Marcial Salazar's own goal, to beat Peru, 2-1, on Wednesday night in the semifinals of the Gold Cup in San Diego.     The own goal by Salazar late in the first half gave Colombia a 1...
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia took advantage of two major defensive lapses, including Marcial Salazar's own goal, to beat Peru, 2-1, on Wednesday night in the semifinals of the Gold Cup in San Diego. The own goal by Salazar late in the first half gave Colombia a 1-0 lead. The Colombians scored again early in the second half when Victor Bonilla walked in for an uncontested goal after a pass by Peru defender Juan Reynoso slipped through the hands of goaltender Oscar Ibanez.
docs.abstract: Colombia beats Peru, 2-1, in semifinals of Gold Cup in San Diego (S)

headline.main: Own Goal Helps Colombia Beat Peru

docs.snippet: THEY have won Emmys and an Oscar. One has spent month after month on the best-seller lists, and one has risen to the top of the fashion world. So why are these celebrities, their wealth and social status assured, competing in beauty contests?    O...
docs.lead_paragraph: THEY have won Emmys and an Oscar. One has spent month after month on the best-seller lists, and one has risen to the top of the fashion world. So why are these celebrities, their wealth and social status assured, competing in beauty contests? Of course, the talk-show hosts Jay Leno and David Letterman, the actor Nicolas Cage, the adventure novelist Clive Cussler and the designer Ralph Lauren are not themselves parading in any swimsuit competitions -- it's their cars that are being judged. All five have made their marks at the peak of the collector-car world, in the beauty pageants of the nation's top concours d'elegance: Pebble Beach in California, Meadow Brook in Michigan, Amelia Island in Florida and the Louis Vuitton Classic in midtown Manhattan.
docs.abstract: Autos on Friday column on some famous car collectors, including novelist Clive Cussler, Jay Leno, Ralph Lauren and Nicolas Cage; photos (M)

headline.main: AUTOS ON FRIDAY/Collecting; It's The Stars' Cars That Steal the Scene

docs.snippet: In case anybody was wondering, Derrell Coley is the man Oscar De La Hoya is fighting on Saturday night at Madison Square Garden. From the billboards advertising the fight to the news conference announcing it, it has been all Oscar all the time.   ...
docs.lead_paragraph: In case anybody was wondering, Derrell Coley is the man Oscar De La Hoya is fighting on Saturday night at Madison Square Garden. From the billboards advertising the fight to the news conference announcing it, it has been all Oscar all the time. ''I've had it,'' said Coley as he stood off to the side while a mob of reporters three rows deep formed a semicircle in front of De La Hoya's table at a news conference at Madison Square Garden yesterday. ''I'm sick of Oscar. I'm sick of Oscar being the man. I could go over there and choke him right now.
docs.abstract: Article on Derrell Coley in view of his upcoming welterweight bout against Oscar De La Hoya at Madison Square Garden (M)

headline.main: Coley, Angry at Slights, Ready for De La Hoya

docs.snippet: Felix Trinidad and Oscar De La Hoya were in Manhattan yesterday, each doing his own thing. The proximity was not by accident.    Trinidad was working out at the Church Street Gym trying to drum up attention for his bout in Las Vegas on March 3 aga...
docs.lead_paragraph: Felix Trinidad and Oscar De La Hoya were in Manhattan yesterday, each doing his own thing. The proximity was not by accident. Trinidad was working out at the Church Street Gym trying to drum up attention for his bout in Las Vegas on March 3 against David Reid, the World Boxing Association superwelterweight champion. Trinidad was hoping his presence would take a little attention away from De La Hoya, who fights Derrell Coley on Saturday night at Madison Square Garden.
docs.abstract: World Boxing Council welterweight champion Felix Trinidad works out at Church Street Gym in Manhattan for his March 3 bout against David Reid in Las Vegas; photo (M)

headline.main: Trinidad Takes Role Of Attention Grabber

docs.snippet: The four-hour Academy Award show is tedious. The jokes often fall flat. The musical numbers can be -- let's face it -- embarrassing. The scripted patter between movie stars is silly. And the barrage of awards leaves television viewers -- especiall...
docs.lead_paragraph: The four-hour Academy Award show is tedious. The jokes often fall flat. The musical numbers can be -- let's face it -- embarrassing. The scripted patter between movie stars is silly. And the barrage of awards leaves television viewers -- especially on the East Coast -- numb and sleepy. Yet who doesn't endure the Oscar show?
docs.abstract: Richard D Zanuck and his wife, Lili Fini Zanuck, new co-producers of 72d anual Academy Awards, comment on plans for this year's show; they are aware that Oscar show, while still very successful, has suffered audience erosion in last few years; producers, mindful of past disasters, are aiming for simplicity; photos of some memorable moments in past Oscar shows (L)

headline.main: Saving the Oscar Show From Itself; Mindful of Past Disasters, the Producers Shoot for Simplicity

docs.snippet: Mandela Implicitly Endorses Clinton      By satellite from 7,200 miles away yesterday, NELSON MANDELA all but endorsed HILLARY RODHAM CLINTON's candidacy for the United States Senate....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mandela Implicitly Endorses Clinton By satellite from 7,200 miles away yesterday, NELSON MANDELA all but endorsed HILLARY RODHAM CLINTON's candidacy for the United States Senate.
docs.abstract: Public Lives column notes that Nelson Mandela, talking to Pres Clinton during satellite peace conference in Tanzania on ending civil war in Burundi, all but endorsed Hillary Rodham Clinton's candidacy for US Senate; also comments on David Letterman's first television show since his bypass surgery; notes that someone has impersonated New York Mets pitcher Dennis Cook in Manhattan while he is at training camp in Florida (M)

docs.snippet: HE is host of a Middle East television seminar at Columbia University, but his Upper West Side apartment is off-limits, hostage to a sublet until March. Face it, when you've gone and married your accountant, you no longer get to pour money into an...
docs.lead_paragraph: HE is host of a Middle East television seminar at Columbia University, but his Upper West Side apartment is off-limits, hostage to a sublet until March. Face it, when you've gone and married your accountant, you no longer get to pour money into an abode you rarely inhabit. Prudence dictates otherwise, even if you happen to be Richard Dreyfuss, a movie star with four decades of celluloid service, and a history of imprudence, under your belt. So Mr. Dreyfuss -- fresh from shooting the 37th film of his checkered career, in the jungles of French Guyana with an iffy jaguar and an anaconda capable of wreaking far more havoc than mere scene-stealing -- is making do in an under-lit hotel suite just north of Lincoln Center, in his favorite neighborhood in the city.
docs.abstract: Public Lives profile of actor Richard Dreyfuss notes that he is host of Middle East television seminar at Columbia University; photo (M)

headline.main: From Turbulence to Tranquillity for Actor
